statement.tex: \text{Find the range of the following functions}\\ \qquad(a)\, f(x) = 2-3x,x\in\mathbb{R}, x\gt 0 \\ \qquad(b)\,f(x)=x^2+2,x\in\mathbb{R} \\ \qquad(c)\,f(x)=x,x\in\mathbb{R}

step.context: \textbf{Right or wrong? }\text{The table below shows valid}\\ \text{values for x and }f(x) = 2-3x.

step.reason: \text{If x can only be }\gt 0,\text{ then }f(x) = 2-3x\text{ can}\\ \text{only decrease as x increases. And there is no}\\ \text{limit to how much f(x) can decrease.}\\ \text{However, }f(x)\ngtr f(0) = 2\implies\textbf{ range = }(-\infty, 2]
x^2\geq 0\text{ for }x\in\mathbb{R}.\text{ Hence, }f(x) = x^2 + 2\gt 0\\ \text{for }x\in\mathbb{R}.\text{ And more precisely, }f(x) = x^2+2\geq 2.\\ \text{Hence, range } = [2,\infty).

step.context: \textbf{And lastly, }\text{ is the following true}\\ \text{for }f(x) = x, x\in\mathbb{R}?
step.reason: \text{For }f(x) = x,\text{ any value x can take, f(x) can take.}\\ \text{And therefore, if }x\in\mathbb{R},\text{ then f(x)'s range } = \mathbb{R}.
